cover_letter_context.background_context: secure application development, threat modeling, and security testing
cover_letter_context.connection_statement: As someone who has directly benefited from WorkSafeBC's support during my time working at SFU Dining Hall, I have a deep personal appreciation for the organization's mission to protect British Columbia's workers. This connection drives my enthusiasm to contribute to the security of systems that serve such a critical purpose.
key_strengths: Strong foundation in secure coding practices (OWASP Top 10) through hands-on web development
Hands-on experience with web security testing tools including BurpSuite and OWASP ZAP through TryHackMe Cyber Security 101 certification (45+ hours)
Experience with SAST concepts through projects like TinyApp and LightBnB that prioritize input validation and SQL injection prevention
Practical understanding of application security testing methodologies from cybersecurity bootcamp labs
Completed threat modeling exercise for AI technologies through TryHackMe Advent of Cyber 2025
Strong network analysis skills with Nmap and Wireshark demonstrated across multiple projects
Self-taught Python and JavaScript developer with continuous learning mindset
Experience with Docker, Linux systems, and cloud technologies through personal homelab projects
learning_areas: While I have foundational hands-on experience with BurpSuite and web security testing from TryHackMe labs, I am eager to develop deeper expertise in enterprise-level usage including advanced features, automated scanning, and integration into CI/CD pipelines
I am eager to expand my practical experience with SonarQube and Mend for comprehensive SAST and SCA in enterprise environments
I am committed to growing my knowledge of Azure cloud security configurations and policies, building on my Docker and Linux experience
I have completed an AI threat modeling exercise through Advent of Cyber 2025 and am eager to deepen my expertise in threat modeling for complex AI technologies and enterprise applications
I have strong motivation to develop penetration testing skills under senior engineers' mentorship, building on my foundation in web security testing
alignment_points: My work at Accessible Places demonstrates my ability to implement security controls and work with distributed teams in a remote environment
My experience building secure web applications with input validation, authentication, and parameterized queries directly supports secure coding standards development
My familiarity with NIST, OWASP Top 10, and MITRE ATT&CK frameworks provides a strong foundation for reviewing designs and conducting threat modeling
My background in both development and security positions me to effectively communicate with cross-functional teams and provide practical guidance to developers
cover_letter_context.transparency_framing: I want to be transparent about where my experience stands: I meet the educational requirements and have built a strong foundation in application security principles through hands-on projects, certifications, and 45+ hours of practical tool training including BurpSuite through TryHackMe. While I may not have 4 years of focused information security work experience in a traditional enterprise setting, I bring 1.5 years of practical cybersecurity work, extensive self-directed learning with tools directly relevant to this role (BurpSuite, OWASP ZAP, Nmap, Wireshark), and proven ability to rapidly acquire new technical skills. I have hands-on experience with web application testing and threat modeling concepts, including AI threat modeling from Advent of Cyber 2025. I am eager to grow into the full scope of this role under the guidance of your senior engineers, bringing enthusiasm, strong fundamentals, and a commitment to continuous learning.
